 0058:     """
 0059:     Calculate the area of the ABCD quadrilataire  with corners:
 0060:     A(a0,a1)
 0061:     B(b0,b1)
 0062:     C(c0,c1)
 0063:     D(d0,d1)
 0064:     @return: area, i.e. 1/2 * (AC ^ BD)
 0065:     """
+0066:     return 0.5 * fabs(((c0 - a0) * (d1 - b1)) - ((c1 - a1) * (d0 - b0)))

 0087:     """
 0088:     integrates the line defined by AB, from A0 to B0
 0089:     param A0: first limit
 0090:     param B0: second limit
 0091:     param AB: struct with the slope and point of intersection of the line
 0092:     """
+0093:     if A0 == B0:
  __pyx_t_1 = ((__pyx_v_A0 == __pyx_v_B0) != 0);
  if (__pyx_t_1) {

+0094:         return 0.0
    __pyx_r = 0.0;
    goto __pyx_L0;
  }
  /*else*/ {

 0095:     else:
+0096:         return AB.slope * (B0 * B0 - A0 * A0) * 0.5 + AB.intersect * (B0 - A0)

 0164:     """
 0165:     Now uses CSR (Compressed Sparse raw) with main attributes:
 0166:     * nnz: number of non zero elements
 0167:     * data: coefficient of the matrix in a 1D vector of float32
 0168:     * indices: Column index position for the data (same size as
 0169:     * indptr: row pointer indicates the start of a given row. len nrow+1
 0170:

 0359: 
+0360:                     AB.slope = (B1 - A1) / (B0 - A0)
            __pyx_v_AB.slope = ((__pyx_v_B1 - __pyx_v_A1) / (__pyx_v_B0 - __pyx_v_A0));

+0361:                     AB.intersect = A1 - AB.slope * A0

 0577:     """
 0578:     Now uses CSR (Compressed Sparse raw) with main attributes:
 0579:     * nnz: number of non zero elements
 0580:     * data: coefficient of the matrix in a 1D vector of float32
 0581:     * indices: Column index position for the data (same size as
 0582:     * indptr: row pointer indicates the start of a given row. len nrow+1

static PyObject *__pyx_pf_3src_17splitPixelFullCSR_15FullSplitCSR_2d_2calc_lut(CYTHON_UNUSED PyObject *__pyx_self, PyObject *__pyx_v_self) {

+1070:     def integrate(self, weights, dummy=None, delta_dummy=None, dark=None, flat=None, solidAngle=None, polarization=None):
/* Python wrapper */
static PyObject *__pyx_pw_3src_17splitPixelFullCSR_15FullSplitCSR_2d_5integrate(PyObject *__pyx_self, PyObject *__pyx_args, PyObject *__pyx_kwds); /*proto*/
static char __pyx_doc_3src_17splitPixelFullCSR_15FullSplitCSR_2d_4integrate[] = "\n        Actually perform the integration which in this case looks more like a matrix-vector product\n\n        @param weights: input image\n        @type weights: ndarray\n        @param dummy: value for dead pixels (optional)\n        @type dummy: float\n        @param delta_dummy: precision for dead-pixel value in dynamic masking\n        @type delta_dummy: float\n        @param dark: array with the dark-current value to be subtracted (if any)\n        @type dark: ndarray\n        @param flat: array with the dark-current value to be divided by (if any)\n        @type flat: ndarray\n        @param solidAngle: array with the solid angle of each pixel to be divided by (if any)\n        @type solidAngle: ndarray\n        @param polarization: array with the polarization correction values to be divided by (if any)\n        @type polarization: ndarray\n        @return : positions, pattern, weighted_histogram and unweighted_histogram\n        @rtype: 4-tuple of ndarrays\n\n        ";

 1073:

 1075:         @type weights: ndarray

 1078:         @param delta_dummy: precision for dead-pixel value in dynamic masking

 1080:         @param dark: array with the dark-current value to be subtracted (if any)
 1081:         @type dark: ndarray
 1082:         @param flat: array with the dark-current value to be divided by (if any)
